bibl.title: Charles W. Sawyer v. T.J. Hamilton. Writ of Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court of the 3rd Judicial District of Washington

body.p: IN THE DISTRICT COURT, Of the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory, holding terms at Seattle, for the Counties of King and Kitsap.
HABEAS CORPUS.
The people of the United States of America, to the Sheriff of King CountyU.S. Marshal of Washington Territory Greeting:

We command you, that you have the body of Chas W. Sawyer by you imprisoned and detained as it is said, together with the time and cause of such imprisonment and detention, by whatsoever name said Chas. W. Sawyer shall be called or charged, before the HON. Roger S. Greene Richard A. Jones, Judge of the aforesaid Court at Seattle King County Washington Territory at Chambers in the Court House in said Seattle on Thursday the 14th day of July, 1887 at 2 o'clock P.M. of that day to do and receive what shall then and there be considered concerning the said Chas. W. Sawyer.
And have you then and there this writ.
WITNESS THE HON Roger S. Greene Richard A. Jones, Judge of said District Court, and the seal thereof this 13th day of July A.D. 1887
James Seavey, Clerk. By William L. Ludlow, Deputy
(Court Seal)
District Court Seattle -
Application of George W. Sawyer for Writ of Habeas Corpus
Writ of Habeas Corpus Petition
FILED Jul 14 1887 James Seavey, Clerk. By. W.E. Ledgerwood, Deputy Clerk.
Lewis + Gilman attys for petitioner
IN THE DISTRICT COURT, Of the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory, holding Terms at Seattle, for the Counties of King and Kitsap.
HABEAS CORPUS
The People of the United States of America, to the Sheriff of King CountyU.S. Marshal of Washington Territory Greeting:

We command you, that you have the body of Chas W. Sawyer by you imprisoned and detained as it is said, together with the time and cause of such imprisonment and detention, by whatsoever name said Chas W. Sawyer shall be called or charged, before the HON. ROGER S. GREENERichard A. Jones Judge of the aforesaid Court at Seattle King County, Washington Territory at Chambers in the Court House in said Seattle on Thursday the 14th day of July 1887 at 2 o'clock P.M. of that day to do and receive what shall then and there be considered concerning the said Chas W Sawyer And have you then and ther this writ.
WITNESS THE HON. ROGER S. GREENERichard A JonesJudge of said District Court and the seal thereof this 13th day of July A. D. 1887 James Seavey, Clerk By Wm. L Ludler. Deputy
United States of America Territory of Washington
To the Honorable Richard A. Jones, Judge of the District Court of the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory, holding Terms at Seattle, for the counties of King and Katsip:

I T.J. Hamilton U.S. Marshal for Washington Territory to whom the within writ is directed, have now here before your honor the body of Charles W. Sawyer therein named together with the time and cause of the imprisonment of said Charles W. Sawyer, therein named, as thereby commanded
Dated this 14th day of July A.D. 1887
T.J. Hamilton U.S. Marshal for Washington Territory by T.W. Goodhire, Deputy
